title: Regal Sharma Family Heritage Archive Website — Frontend Implementation Plan

requirements.summary: Create multi-page site structure with top-level navigation and routes for all required sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation is present on desktop and collapses appropriately on mobile.
Each route renders a dedicated page with consistent layout (header/nav/footer) and page title.
All pages are reachable without dead links and do not require authentication.

file_operations.description: Add the app shell and client-side routing for: Home, Founding Era, Akhnoor Sovereignty, Forts & Residences, Lineage & Family Tree, Royal Administration & Legacy, Post-1947 Transition, Current Generation, Gallery & Archives, Timeline, and Contact / Family Contributions; ensure each route renders within the shared layout.
Create a consistent page layout with header/nav/footer wrapper applied to every route, ensuring consistent spacing and typography across pages.

Implement top navigation with desktop links and a mobile-collapsing menu; use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Navigation Menu + Sheet/Drawer patterns) to support responsive navigation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create the Home page route component with page title and placeholder sections to be filled in subsequent requirements.
Create the Founding Era page route component with consistent headings and layout.
Create the Akhnoor Sovereignty page route component with consistent headings and layout.
Create the Forts & Residences page route component with consistent headings and layout.
Create the Lineage & Family Tree page route component with consistent headings and layout.
Create the Royal Administration & Legacy page route component with consistent headings and layout.
Create the Post-1947 Transition page route component with consistent headings and layout.
Create the Current Generation page route component with consistent headings and layout.
Create the Gallery & Archives page route component with consistent headings and layout.
Create the Timeline page route component with consistent headings and layout.
Create the Contact / Family Contributions page route component with consistent headings and layout.

requirements.summary: Implement historically grounded, museum-like visual design with parchment texture, deep red/gold accents, elegant typography, and subtle animations.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent design system (colors/typography/spacing) is applied across all pages.
Animations are subtle (e.g., fade/slide on section entry) and respect reduced-motion preferences.
The UI avoids overly modern/flashy elements and reads as an archive/chronicle.

file_operations.description: Define global design tokens (colors, typography, spacing), base element styles, focus states, and subtle motion classes; apply parchment-like background treatment and deep red/gold accents using CSS variables and Tailwind layers.
Extend Tailwind theme to include heritage palette aliases (deep red, muted gold, parchment neutrals), typography tuning, and animation utilities appropriate for calm, scholarly motion.
Apply the museum-like styling at the layout level (background texture layer, content container, typographic rhythm, ornamental dividers) so all pages inherit the consistent aesthetic.
Add generated parchment texture asset and reference it from the global/layout styling as a subtle background layer (no critical content embedded in the image).
Add generated ornamental divider asset and wire it into section separators in layout and/or key pages.
Add generated crest emblem asset and wire it into header/footer branding with appropriate alt text.
Add generated Akhnoor fort etching asset and wire it into the Home hero and/or relevant history page sections with appropriate alt text.
Add generated archival seal asset and wire it into callouts (e.g., contributions page or citations blocks) with appropriate alt text.

requirements.summary: Populate the site with provided historical narrative content and add placeholders for future research, citations, and oral histories.
acceptanceCriteria: All key historical points provided by the user are present in appropriate sections/pages.
Pages include clearly labeled placeholder blocks for future citations, sources, and oral histories without breaking layout.
User-facing text is formal and historically careful (no sensational language).

file_operations.description: Create a single source of truth for the provided historical narrative (structured content blocks per page/section), including placeholders for future research and oral histories.
Render the provided Founding Era narrative sections (including Lakshmandev Singh Sharma context) and include clearly labeled placeholder blocks for future research/oral histories.
Render the provided narrative points about Lakshmandev Singh Sharma under Maharaja Gulab Singh, the Diwani grant, administrative legacy, and add placeholders for citations and oral histories.
Render the narrative about autonomy over Akhnoor and related sovereignty context, with placeholders for sources and future research.
Render the post-1947 transition narrative and include labeled placeholders for additional documentation and oral histories.

requirements.summary: Build the Home page hero, introduction, and highlighted history cards linking to deeper pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section includes a tagline and short introductory paragraph.
At least 3–6 highlight items link to relevant pages (e.g., Founding Era, Sovereignty, Lineage, Timeline, Archives).
Home page remains readable and well-spaced on mobile screens.

file_operations.description: Implement Home hero banner with dignified tagline, brief introduction to the royal lineage, and 3–6 highlight cards/sections that link to the required deeper routes; use shadcn-ui Card/Button primitives for consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable highlights grid component used on Home to present linked historical sections in a calm, museum-like card layout; use shadcn-ui Card patterns. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Create an interactive, expandable family tree visualization for the direct lineage with biographical note placeholders and a present-generation note.
acceptanceCriteria: Family tree supports expanding/collapsing or focusing nodes (works on both desktop and mobile).
Selecting a person shows biographical notes (placeholder text allowed where details are not provided).
A visible note clarifies Aarav Sharma as the present generation.

file_operations.description: Define the direct lineage dataset (Lakshmandev Singh Sharma → ... → Aarav Sharma) with optional biographical note placeholders per person.

Implement an interactive, expandable/focusable family tree component optimized for desktop and mobile; use shadcn-ui Accordion/Collapsible patterns where helpful for expand/collapse UX. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a details panel/modal component that renders the selected person’s biographical notes (placeholder text allowed) with accessible headings and keyboard focus management; use shadcn-ui Dialog (optional) for small screens. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the FamilyTree visualization into the Lineage & Family Tree page and include an explicit visible note that Aarav Sharma represents the present generation carrying forward the legacy.

requirements.summary: Implement an interactive timeline page with chronological milestones, expandable entries, and citation placeholders per milestone.
acceptanceCriteria: Timeline renders a chronological list with expand/collapse or detail view per entry.
Timeline entries include a dedicated area for citations/sources (can be empty placeholders initially).
Timeline is keyboard-navigable and readable on mobile.

file_operations.description: Create a structured set of chronological milestone entries (initial placeholders allowed) including fields for title, period/date, description, and sources/citations placeholders.

Build an interactive timeline list with expand/collapse behavior per entry; use shadcn-ui Accordion components to provide accessible disclosure patterns. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Render the TimelineList on the Timeline page, ensuring chronological ordering, keyboard operability, and mobile readability.

requirements.summary: Create Gallery & Archives browsing UI with category filtering and an item detail view including metadata fields.
acceptanceCriteria: Archive supports filtering or tabbing by the 4 categories.
Clicking an item opens a detail view (modal or page) showing metadata fields.
Initial content may be placeholders but the viewer UI is functional.

file_operations.description: Define placeholder archive items across categories (Photographs, Letters, Documents, Artifacts) with metadata fields (title, date/period, description, source/citation, notes).

Implement archive browsing UI with category tabs and a grid/list of items; use shadcn-ui Tabs and Card components for filtering and presentation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create an item detail view (modal dialog) that shows all required metadata fields and supports keyboard navigation; use shadcn-ui Dialog for accessible modal behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the ArchiveBrowser into the Gallery & Archives page and ensure item click opens the detail view with metadata.

requirements.summary: Add Current Generation page profiling Tilak Raj, Rajkumar, and Aarav with a continuity-of-traditions section.
acceptanceCriteria: All three profiles are displayed with consistent styling and clear titles/roles.
Page includes a dedicated section about continuity of traditions with placeholder text clearly labeled as such.
Names and honorifics match the user-provided spelling/casing.

file_operations.description: Implement three profile sections with the exact names/honorifics and roles: Rawal/Raja Tilak Raj Singh Sharma (current head), Kunwar Rajkumar Singh Sharma (successor), Bhanwar Aarav Singh Sharma (next generation); include a clearly labeled placeholder section describing continuity of traditions.

Create a consistent profile card/section component for the three profiles; use shadcn-ui Card and typography patterns for a scholarly presentation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement Contact / Family Contributions form UI and submit data to backend for persistence, with validation and success confirmation.
acceptanceCriteria: Form validates required fields and consent before submission.
On successful submit, the submission is stored via backend API and the UI shows a success confirmation.
Backend exposes a method to list submissions (for future admin use) without requiring third-party services.

file_operations.description: Build the contributions submission form with fields: name, email, relationship/affiliation, message, optional attachment metadata, and consent checkbox; implement client-side validation and accessible error messaging; use shadcn-ui Input/Textarea/Checkbox/Button components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a React Query mutation hook that calls the backend capability submitForm(submissionId, submission) and returns loading/success/error states for the UI.

Wire the ContributionsForm into the Contact / Family Contributions page, display a success confirmation state on successful submission, and handle backend errors gracefully without requiring authentication.
Create a success confirmation UI block shown after submission, providing a scholarly acknowledgment and next-steps messaging (no promotional tone).

requirements.summary: Add a consistent Sources / Citations UI block pattern across relevant pages, timeline entries, and archive item details.
acceptanceCriteria: At least the History pages, Timeline, and Archive item detail views include a “Sources / Citations” block.
When no sources are present, an accessible placeholder message is shown.
Sources are rendered as plain text and/or links with safe external-link behavior.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable “Sources / Citations” block component that renders a list of references (plain text and/or links) with an accessible empty state and safe external-link handling.
Integrate the SourcesCitationsBlock into the Founding Era page in relevant sections with placeholder empty-state messaging.
Integrate the SourcesCitationsBlock into the Akhnoor Sovereignty page in relevant sections with placeholder empty-state messaging.
Integrate the SourcesCitationsBlock into the Royal Administration & Legacy page in relevant sections with placeholder empty-state messaging.
Integrate the SourcesCitationsBlock into the Post-1947 Transition page in relevant sections with placeholder empty-state messaging.
Render SourcesCitationsBlock within each timeline entry’s expanded content to display citations/sources or the empty placeholder state.
Render SourcesCitationsBlock within the archive item detail view to display an item’s source/citation field or an empty placeholder state.

requirements.summary: Ensure mobile responsiveness and accessibility: semantic headings, keyboard navigation, contrast, focus states, alt text, and reduced-motion support.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages are usable on common mobile widths without horizontal scrolling.
Interactive components (nav, timeline, tree, gallery viewer, form) are keyboard-operable with visible focus.
Reduced-motion preference is respected and images include meaningful alt text (placeholders allowed).

file_operations.description: Add/verify global focus ring styles, contrast-friendly defaults, and reduced-motion handling for any global animations/transitions.
Ensure mobile nav is keyboard-operable (focus trapping if using a sheet), uses semantic landmarks, and provides visible focus states; ensure links are reachable without dead-ends.
Ensure expand/collapse and person selection are keyboard-accessible, with visible focus indicators and mobile-friendly touch targets.
Ensure timeline disclosure controls are keyboard-operable, have clear focus states, and do not rely on motion-only cues.
Ensure category tabs/filtering are accessible (keyboard navigation, aria labeling where appropriate) and grid/list remains readable on small screens.
Ensure the item detail dialog has correct focus management, close controls, and keyboard navigation, and that metadata is readable on mobile.
Ensure form labels, required indicators, validation messages, and consent checkbox are accessible; ensure no horizontal scrolling on mobile.
Add meaningful alt text for decorative/illustrative images used on the Home page (placeholders allowed) and ensure responsive layout for hero/highlights.

requirements.summary: Add SEO essentials: per-route titles and meta descriptions where feasible, meaningful headings, and indexable text content.
acceptanceCriteria: Each route sets an appropriate document title.
Each page has a single H1 and a logical heading hierarchy beneath it.
Primary historical and lineage content is rendered as text in the DOM (not embedded solely in images).

file_operations.description: Create a small hook to set document.title (and optionally meta description via DOM APIs) per route without adding authentication or third-party SEO services.
Set route-specific document title and meta description using usePageMeta; ensure a single H1 and clear heading hierarchy; ensure primary content is text in the DOM.
Set route-specific document title and meta description using usePageMeta; enforce single H1 and logical headings; ensure narrative content is text.

Set route-specific document title and meta description using usePageMeta; enforce single H1 and logical headings; ensure narrative content is text.
Set route-specific document title and meta description using usePageMeta; enforce single H1 and logical headings; ensure narrative content is text.
Set route-specific document title and meta description using usePageMeta; enforce single H1 and logical headings; ensure profiles are rendered as text.
Set route-specific document title and meta description using usePageMeta; enforce single H1 and logical headings; ensure archive metadata is rendered as text.
Set route-specific document title and meta description using usePageMeta; enforce single H1 and logical headings; ensure timeline milestones are text content.
